summary:
## Monitor Lizards: Big, Strong, and Wide-Ranging

Monitor lizards are a diverse group of over 80 species found across Africa, Asia, Oceania, and even the Americas. They're known for their long necks, strong tails and claws, and powerful legs. Sizes vary greatly, from tiny 8-inch species to the massive 10-foot Komodo dragon, and possibly even a prehistoric giant over 23 feet long!

Most live on land, but some climb trees or live near water. They mostly eat meat, but a few species also eat fruit and plants.
title: Monitor lizard
